summary: Santiago is Chile's capital and biggest city, located in the central valley. Founded in 1541 by Spanish explorer Pedro de Valdivia, it has been the country's political and financial hub since colonial times. The city has a diverse architectural style, ranging from neoclassical to art deco. Santiago is surrounded by hills and the Mapocho River, with nearby mountains and the Pacific Ocean just an hour away. It is home to many important businesses and organizations, and the Chilean government's executive and judiciary branches are based here.
title: Santiago
